benchmark_details.name: GAUSS (General Assessment of Underlying Structured Skills in Mathematics)
benchmark_details.overview: GAUSS evaluates LLMsâ€™ mathematical abilities across twelve core skill dimensions, organized around knowledge, problem solving, and creativity, providing detailed insights into model performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a structured and interpretable benchmark for evaluating the mathematical skills of large language models (LLMs).
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited scope of problems and potential biases in task selection.

data.source: Specifically derived mathematical problems and assessment tasks designed for evaluating LLMs.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts for the required skill scoring.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the detailed performance of LLMs across various mathematical tasks as outlined in the tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted in terms of strength and weakness profiles for model capabilities in mathematics.
methodology.baseline_results: Results are benchmarked against existing models like GPT-5.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures are based on assessing model performance against human-level benchmarks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Evenly distributed coverage across samples to avoid demographic bias.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY 4.0 license used for distribution of the benchmark and materials.
